intro: Pilosella corymbulifera, commonly known as the clustered hairvetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often forming a corymb-like arrangement. Its leaves are typically hairy and alternate, with a basal rosette structure. Pilosella corymbulifera is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
